example.text: We in Alabama have a proud tradition of supporting our national security & service members. [[user]]'s dangerous and unprecedented hold on military promotions does not reflect our values. He needs to lift his hold and let our officers get back to work defending our nation.

Great work day in Selma! I am so proud to continue working hard with our partners to craft a collaborative long-term recovery plan that will ensure communities affected by the Jan. 12 storms rebuild better and stronger than before. ? ? [[url]]

I just introduced the Maternal Vaccination Act! At a time when Black women are three times more likely to die from pregnancy and childbirth, this bill will help ensure that our mothers and babies are protected against deadly, preventable diseases. [[url]]

Republicans have pushed our economy to the brink of crisis, and now, just days away from a default, they have chosen to send us home. This is a shameful dereliction of duty. I’m calling on [[user]] and my Republican colleagues to immediately return and do their job!!! [[url]]

Thanks to President Biden's approval of a major disaster declaration, federal assistance is now available to individuals, local governments, nonprofits, and businesses to recover and rebuild. I have made it my mission to ensure that the members of our community know how to access the resources available, which is why I invite you to join my LIVE Telephone Town Hall happening today, Thursday, January 26 at 6:30 p.m.

This NDAA will bolster America’s national security and advance our leadership on the world stage, and I was proud to vote for it.” Passed annually by Congress since 1961, the NDAA authorizes funding levels for the Department of Defense. This legislation allows the Armed Forces to pay, train and equip US service members, support America’s allies around the world, and carry out essential national security operations.
